title: Sexiest letter forms poll
content:
What do you consider to be the sexiest letter form or character? Next, what do you consider to be the sexiest part of the letter (for one form or characters in general)? Finally, what do you consider to be the sexiest type face?   
   
 I'm a communication design student at Emily Carr in Vancouver and I'm polling this informartion for a project I'm doing on the sensuality and potential sexual connontations of type. Any replies will be greatly appreciated.   
   
Thank you.   
   
` )   
(   
` -=====-
author: typoyeur

comments.content:
ligatures are obvious   
X or x is often used in simplified cartoons for kisses and the whole XXX thing, then there's "xoxo" which is pretty universal.   
   
really I think V is purdy sexah.   
   
but flip-side I think D, B, S, 6, anything that looks like it has a beer belly would be unsexy. perhaps because I'm female and prefer certain shapes...whereas a male might think its a pregnant lady and go "woo"   
   
what ever you say though, exclamation marks - they just aren't too subtle...about as sexy as a pick-up line.

"z" ... there's something wicked about "z" and that'ssexy.   
   
Sexiest part of a letter? Subtle curves, where the leg connects on the "R". Typeface? That's hard. Caslon, maybe.

If you haven't seen it already, you might want to [check out this](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108152303/http:/www.xs4all.nl/~maxb/erotype.html), David.   
   
As for me though...I guess I think lc 'k' is pretty hot. And lc 'a' and 'e' with ogonek.   
   
Sexiest part...where the bowl joins the stem on lc 'n' (m, h, u). There's just something about crotches ;-)   
   
And no idea what the sexiest face would be. Not Mrs. Eaves ligatures though - those are just plain obscene...

O is for orifice.   
   
The bowl of the lower case a, especially in grotesques like Helvetica, is a breasty shape.   
   
Modula Ribbed.   
   
David, statistical analysis of pornography is worth considering. You may be able to search online using keywords such as "slut" and "comic sans", although this would not capture information about bitmapped typography.   
   
On a personal note, growing up in the heyday of Playboy, I've always been partial to a little Baskerville.

\> Modula Ribbed   
   
Especially the 3D version in Abbot Miller's "Dimensional Typography". In fact, David, you should definitely get your sweaty hands on that little book. :-) It has a few other erotic entries too.
